sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4}. Find the Cartesian product (A × B) and (B × A), then determine the symmetric difference between the two sets. Show that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
